div1.p: Truby thinks Kean will be surprised by Pinto's remarks about Truby's manuscript.

div1.head: Letter from Albert E. Truby to Philip Showalter Hench, September 26, 1941
div1.opener:
In case you
want to make notes
in the mms. why
not have them
typed as Pinto
did and put
them in the book.
Then have your
secy send me
duplicates for
my retained
copy. That
would save
much time
in case the S.G.
wants to have
the completed mms
in a hurry
AET
Albert E. Truby
145 Laurel Street
San Francisco, California
Sept. 26, 41
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Dr. Pinto returned the copy of my
mms. which he had and I sent it
off to you by Railway Express yesterday.

I want you to see Pinto's remarks and
his letters and when you are through
with the mms. please send it to Gen. K.
right away. He wants to see what
Pinto has to say, and when he is through
with that copy I will tell him where
to send it.

I am in the midst of an attack
of diverticulitis a condition which bothers me
frequently. I can usually abort the
attacks and that is what I am trying
to do now. This letter is therefore
very brief.

Will inclose a letter form General Kean
which will show you what he & Ireland
propose re. my mms. Perhaps that
is the best way to handle the matter
but I can't decide until Col Rogers
of the S.G.O. tells us what can be
AC
T
done. I know nothing about
publishing matters. Perhaps you
have some ideas that will help
us. The circulation of the Medical
Bulletin is of course very limited and
I have no idea as to how many
copies would be run off at Carlisle.

I think that Kean will be agreeably
surprised by Pinto's remarks. He has
confirmed several of the things I wanted
to know and has not made any
statements that seem radical or untrue
as Kean expected. Please return Kean's
letter to me when you are through with
it.

A couple days ago I sailed out of
the golden gate (5 a.m.) into the Pacific in a
small motor boat for salmon
fishing. There were four of us in
the party and we brought back 8 big ones
from 20-27½ lbs. I got the big one.

It is hard work and a lot of
excitement and that is what probably
caused my digestive upset and invalvent
of the diverticuli.
